author: TravisEz13
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->
## Steps to reproduce

The actual assembly is version 2.0.0.0

```
$fullName = 'Some.Assembly.Name, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad362222'
$assemblyName = [System.Reflection.AssemblyName]::new($fullName)
[System.Reflection.Assembly]::Load($assemblyName)
```
## Expected behavior

 Expected: {FileLoadException}
## Actual behavior

   But was:  {FileNotFoundException}
## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

``` powershell
> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSEdition                      Core
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
CLRVersion
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
WSManStackVersion              3.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.7-378-g86c5d3e4c88fe1489dcb657132e64dd8535da6a1
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha

```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: @TravisEz13 do you have a repro here that we can validate against `6.0.0-beta.1`? This one's just a touch over my head.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @joeyaiello The existing repro still repro's.  Did it not repro for you?

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body: Gotcha, it's just the wrong exception. Stinks, but we could do this whenever.

title: Fully qualified error id has changes  when loading  an assembly with higher version of different public key
